batch

Class BatchBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • batch.BatchBuilder

  • public final class BatchBuilder
extends java.lang.Object

    Implements the Builder design pattern for step-by-step construction of a BatchExecutor instance. This base class provides setter methods to configure batch parameters, which can then be used to create a new BatchExecutor using the build() method.

    Example: 

     
 Builder batch = new Builder()
         .source("D:\\KDR Project\\Milestones\\TestBatch")
         .target("local\\images")
         .name("image")
         .descending(true)
         .userDate("26 4 2006")
         .build();
    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

      Sets a prefix to be prepended to each output image file name.

      Sets the target directory where copied image files are saved to.

      • build

        public BatchExecutor build()
                    throws BatchErrorException
        Begins the batch handling process.
        Returns:
        a newly created instance of the BatchImageEngine outer class
        Throws:
        BatchErrorException - in case of an error during batch processing
